result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Allen Kastner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy Allen Kastner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy Allen Kastner was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jeremy Allen Kastner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Jeremy Allen Kastner was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jeremy Allen Kastner was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Allen Kastner

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy Allen Kastner appeared by video, in custody of Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson by video for Jeremy Allen Kastner.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared by video. Attorney Erickson and defendant go to breakout session to review plea questionnaire. Attorney Erickson then enters courtroom and appears in person. Defendant remains by video. Per agreement, defendant to plead to Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5. Counts 4 and 6 dismissed. State heard on prior convictions. Attorney Erickson heard. Defendant heard. Victim has no comment. Court heard and orders 90 days jail on Count 1, 9 months jail on Count 2, 30 days jail on Count 3 and 3 years WSPS (1&2) on Count 5, all concurrent to each other and current sentence. Conditions of extended supervision: Counseling, random drug testing, court costs on each count with fail to pay civil judgment, DNA. Credit 262 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Allen Kastner appeared by video from GCJ, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared in court for Jeremy Allen Kastner, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Sgt. Mark Schwartz is sworn and testifies. Cross-examined by Atty Erickson. State moves for bond over. Atty Erickson objects. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial. State filed Information. Defendant waives further reading and stands mute to the charges. clerk enters Not Guilty plea. Status: 4/13/22 at 9:00 am. JT Weeks: 4/26 & 5/3. A set JT date will be 4/26/22.

Review scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy Allen Kastner appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared in court for Jeremy Allen Kastner, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared by video. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. State requests $1000 cash bond. Attorney Erickson heard and requests signature bond. No contact discussed but not ordered. Bond set at $1000 cash. Defendant is being held on revocation in 15CF141. Preliminary hearing set. Defendant is agreeable to video appearance from jail.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
